titleStmt.title: Description of British Library, Or 2491: Torah

availability.licence: These images and the content of British Library Or 2491: Torah are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. See the Creative Commons Public Domain Mark page for usage details, http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/mark/1.0/.

To the extent possible under law, British Library has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to this metadata about British Library Or 2491: Torah. This work is published from: United States. For a summary of CC0, see https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Legal code: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.

notesStmt.note: Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Fragments of Genesis, Exodus, Numbers and Deuteronomy, with the Arabic translation of the Karaite Yeshuʿah ben 'Ari or al-Shaikh Abu 'l-Faraj Furḳan ibn Asad; fragments of Genesis with the Arabic translation of the Karaite Japhet ben Ali.

msItem.title: Fragments of Genesis, Exodus, Numbers and Deuteronomy.

supportDesc.extent: Part I: Folios 1-44 Part II: Folios 42-63.;

layoutDesc.layout: 1 column(s); Oriental paper, ruled with mastara. Part I: 1 column(s); ruled lines: 11; written lines: 11; The beginning of the weekly section is indicated in the margin by the word פרש' enclosed in a rough pen and ink design. The number of verses in each weekly section is registered at the end. Part II: 1 column(s); ruled lines: 13; written lines: 13; Hebrew text written in square script, with a simple punctuation and accentuation.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Part I: Square and semi-cursive Oriental script.Part II: Oriental square and semi-cursive script.

origin.origPlace: Part I: Syria, Lebanon, or Iraq?

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Museum from him on 08 July 1882 ([64v]).
